attributes.action: Require routine checks for newborns for the condition of ankyloglossia.
attributes.background: Tongue-tie (or ankyloglossia) is a ‘congenital condition in which the tip of the tongue cannot be protruded beyond the lower incisor teeth because of a short frenulum’ (Wallace, 1963).  Tongue-ties can cause problems with feeding / sleeping / speech
attributes.additional_details: For weeks after my son was born we had issues with his feeding, he would scream in agony for 8 hours solidly each day, could not feed or be pacified. A total of seven health professionals didn’t / or couldn’t diagnose his condition. There should be more training to spot the condition and it should form part of a routine, standard check at birth for every newborn.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for transplant recipients
attributes.background: Transplant patients are on immune suppressants and anti-rejection medication for the rest of their life. As with a lot of other illnesses, they shouldn't have to pay for them.

attributes.action: Pay all government in-house & outsourced staff the real living wage
attributes.background:
Thousands of employees working for the government earn under the real living wage - currently £10.55 p/hour in London & £9.00 p/hour outside of London.

All workers deserve at least the living wage & the government should be leading by example ensuring that in-house & outsourced staff receive it.
attributes.additional_details: Currently nearly 3,000 workers at the Ministry of Justice (MoJ) earn below the real living wage, as do hundreds of workers who are outsourced at the MoJ such as security guards, cleaners and receptionists. They are now taking strike action through their union United Voices of the World (UVW), as are outsourced staff through PCS Union at the Department of Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) simply because the government won't listen and refuses to pay them a wage they can live off.

attributes.action: Make retailers that sell drinks sell at least 30% of them in non plastic.
attributes.background:
Plastic is causing catastrophic effects in the environment we all live in. 
So why do many large, and small High Street retailers still sell ONLY plastic bottles of drinks? 
If there is a choice, people will be able to choose to not have plastic. The % should increase 10% each year for 4 years.
attributes.additional_details:
In our local NHS hospital a large multinational retailer only sells plastic bottled drinks.
A local chain of bakeries only sells drinks in plastic bottles.
There is already too much recyclable plastic that isn't recycled in the world. Drinks bottles use New plastic, not recycled plastic. Cutting down on New plastic for these drinks bottles will cut down the plastic that will then enter into the environment. 
Quicker, and easier to implement that a plastic bottle refund scheme.

attributes.action: Urge Russia to free British Citizen Paul Whelan from Moscow Prison
attributes.background: Our brother and cousin, Paul Whelan, a loyal, compassionate and loving member of our family, was arrested in Moscow on December 28th and is currently being held at the high security Lefortovo prison.
attributes.additional_details:
Paul regularly travels across the globe and has enjoyed visiting Russia as he has a keen interest in the language and culture. On this occasion he travelled to Moscow to attend a friend’s wedding and has been arrested on suspicion of spying. Paul is NOT a spy. We are extremely worried about him and want to see his immediate release.

Due to the workings of the Russian court system, he could be held for years before a trial or sentencing. His family in both the United Kingdom and the United States are working behind the scenes to ensure that Paul has access to legal representation and that his basic needs are met. He is currently being held in isolation and we fear for his mental health.

attributes.action: Allow school absences due to diagnosed mental health issues to be ‘authorised’
attributes.background: Increase awareness and acceptance of the mental health issues our young children and teenagers grow up with to ensure that absences due to these issues are authorised. The education system should recognise diagnosed mental health issues as an “authorised” reason to be absent from school.
attributes.additional_details: As a mother to a 5yr old suffering with severe ongoing mental health issues, autism & health conditions , I am constantly having to fight for her mental health issues to be recognised as a more than valid reason to remain at home for the day. We struggle some days to get off the sofa, talk, sleep & eat. When reporting absence to the school we are questioned whether there is sickness & as there is not absence is still reported as ‘unauthorised’ despite multiple diagnosis from professionals.

attributes.action: Intruduce Commercial Dog Walking to be a licensed and inspected profession
attributes.background: Commercial dog walking has become massive in recent years and it would appear that nothing is required to practice. Some do provide excellent service to help our dogs have a better life whilst we are at work etc however there are many who walk no limit of dogs, do not clean up and intimidate others.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst using the South Downs on a regular basis I come across many dog walkers. They walk up to 8 dogs individually & not all on leads. Myself & my dog find when the dogs approach intimidating & quite often do not clear up after the dogs or have control. Something needs to be put in place for the sake of the general public who want to walk their dogs without the worry of feeling intimidated when walking the downs or any public space. Kennels & Boarders are licenced & inspected & must be trained & insured to protect OUR pets.A license should be a requirement to allow Authorities to inspect vehicles used to transport dogs, check on insurance and the walkers experience. Numbers walked commercially must also be limited.

attributes.action: Make baby CPR compulsory in all antenatal classes within the hospitals
attributes.background:
As it stands parents have to pay to undergo a course to learn how to give CPR and how to deal with choking in infants and babies. 

After losing our son, we believe that no parent should have to pay to learn this skill.
attributes.additional_details:
We were taught how to give CPR and how to deal with choking when we were discharged from the neonatal unit as Johnny had been ill. This was part of their discharge procedure, however other parents are not taught this before leaving the hospitals. 

Our antenatal classes did not teach this basic skill either and all parents should be given the right on knowing what to do in an emergency.

attributes.action: Fund Research to Prevent and Treat Asherman's Syndrome.
attributes.background: In 2009, I was pregnant with my one and only pregnancy. At my three-month scan, I was told there was no heartbeat and that I needed to have an ERPC. Following this I was diagnosed with Asherman's Syndrome, which then caused me to become infertile. This Silent Syndrome has been recognised since 1948.
attributes.additional_details: Asherman's Syndrome is scarring (adhesions) of the uterus. This scarring causes lighter periods or no periods at all and, in almost all women who are affected, infertility. It most often develops after a common minor operation called a D&C (dilation and curettage) and often following a missed miscarriage. In this case it's called an ERPC (evacuation of retained products of conception). It is estimated that around 60,000 - 100,000 D&Cs are carried out each year and many women remain undiagnosed.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the death penalty and make life sentences actually life.
attributes.background: Reintroduce the death penalty for evil and callous crimes. Make life sentences actually life behind bars, for example an 80 year sentence. This way we can protect the public and save lives.

attributes.action: UK Government to ban the import of shark fins into the UK.
attributes.background:
73 million sharks killed every year for shark fin soup, sharks are thrown back to the sea where they will die after having their fins brutally cut from their bodies.
 Loopholes are allowing people to continue smuggling fins in to the U.K despite a ban put in place in over 27 countries in 2013.

attributes.action: Immediately amend the future carbon budget targets
attributes.background:
The latest IPCC report, SR15, details the significant change of circumstances which have take place since the Climate Change Act of 2008.
We therefore need to amend the fourth carbon budget target to 60% by 2025 and the fifth to 70% by 2030.
attributes.additional_details: see http://www.ipcc.ch/report/sr15/

attributes.action: Introduce funding to help families of home-schooled children pay for GCSE exams
attributes.background: The decision to homeschool is not taken lightly and is made for many reasons; ultimately to ensure the happiness/wellbeing of a child. The cost of teaching at home is accepted and managed, however many families find it difficult to pay the high fees for GCSE’s that are free in our state schools

attributes.action: Fund an A&E facility in Wellingborough
attributes.background: Wellingborough is an expanding town and predicted to continue growing over the coming decades, but our nearest A&E facilities are either in Kettering or Northampton.
attributes.additional_details:
These towns are growing rapidly and the two existing hospitals struggle to cope with their own population - even without the ever increasing workload from Wellingborough.

We appreciate that funding is always limited when it comes to healthcare - however the expansion of the town and the dependence (for many) on public transport, means that effective, timely A&E treatment is often pivotal on ambulance availability.

We already have a superb Hospital in Wellingborough (The Isebrook) but it lacks the crucial A&E facility the town so urgently requires.

The upgrade will also result in reduced patient-load on both Kettering and Northampton A&E departments too.

attributes.action: Introduce tougher penalties for commercial fly-tipping
attributes.background:
Millions of pounds of taxpayer's money is spent clearing up behind these unscrupulous criminals, the current legislation does not appear to be an effective deterrent.

The cost of clearance to local authorities in England in 2017/18 was £12.2 million, for large fly-tipping incidents.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls upon Parliament to debate the illegal industrial sized fly-tipping that blights our nation. Specifically, the petition calls for Parliament to debate: 

(i)   Whether the relevant enforcement agencies are adequately resourced to enforce existing legislation?
(ii)  Whether current legislation is being implemented robustly by Her Majesty's Court Service?
(iii) Whether Parliament needs to consider passing new legislation to provide an effective deterrent?

attributes.action: NOT to ban the sale of fireworks to the public
attributes.background: Fireworks bring joy to many people of all ages and it is part of a tradition that goes back hundreds of years. Banning fireworks will not only ruin our Guy Fawkes tradition but will also have a massive impact on our multi cultural celebrations to such as diwali.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to use parent-child spaces if you do not have a child with you
attributes.background: I would like parent-child spaces to be considered with the same respect as disabled spaces and be offered as a matter of course in all public car parks. As a mother of 2 infants I am left to struggle getting them out of the car in an unsafe space because people without a child use the child spaces.
attributes.additional_details: There is a safety issue as the extra space allowed in a child space means children can get in and out safely without being right next to the moving wheels of other vehicles. Additionally, these spaces are often closer to the trolley park or business entrance meaning if you have to get a special trolley to use or are carrying infants you don't have to go too far from the car in order to be able to do this safely. Having to carry children, baby bags and your shopping is very difficult already!

attributes.action: Provide funding to Staffordshire County Council to reduce a £35 million deficit
attributes.background: Staffordshire County Council has already slashed running costs by £240 million in 9 years. There is a further forecast £35 million reduction that will see much needed services for Staffordshire people reduced or even removed. Therefore we are asking the UK Government to provide adequate funding.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are just a few of the proposed cuts: 

• School crossing patrols
• Review cost of children’s resident provision
• Review alternative autism funding
• Review of Victoria Centre of history grant 
• Removal of non-statutory community transport 
• Removal of concessionary travel before 09.30 
• Reduction in grants to voluntary community social enterprise
• Review of Adult learning disability provisions to remove preventive services
• Review remaining financial support for hate crime

attributes.action: Regulate service charges on properties
attributes.background: Unlike, for example with financial advisors, property managers are unregulated. The company set the charge and “deliver” the service. Without regulation, it is near impossible for leaseholders to resolve cases where the charge is excessive for the service level. Regulation is desperately needed.
attributes.additional_details:
If service charge is excessive, current options are:
 
Pay up. Money makes the world go round!
 
Fire the firm IF you can get a enough leaseholders, and money. Hope the next ones better!
 
Formal complaint, court or a tribunal. All require significant time, courts/tribunals require money. Neither likely to succeed since proving wrong without any regulations to define “wrong” is near impossible against their lawyer armies. Also, all formal proceedings are public, potentially devaluing your property.

attributes.action: Allow all British citizens to vote should there be a new referendum on Brexit.
attributes.background: When the referendum on leaving the EU took place in 2016, a large number of British Citizens were not allowed to register their vote for a series of reasons laid down by the government. Obviously this matter affects ALL British citizens equally, therefore they should all have an equal right to vote
attributes.additional_details:
British citizens living abroad for more than 15 years can’t vote. 
I was one of the 700,000 British people denied a vote in the first EU referendum – that's why we need another Brexit vote

attributes.action: Hold European Parliamentary elections in UK if Brexit is delayed
attributes.background: If the UK is still a member of the EU on May 23rd, British citizens and EU27 citizens in the UK must have representation through their MEPs in the European Parliament. Having representation in these elections also crucially allows the UK time to arrange a second referendum on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: We call on Theresa May and the Government to bring forward legislative amendment to Schedule 9 of the EU (Withdrawal) Act 2018, which lists the European Parliamentary Elections Act 2002 and the European Parliament (Representation) Act 2003 among the Acts to be wholly repealed. This must be done to ensure that the European Parliamentary elections can take place in the UK on 23rd May 2019.

attributes.action: Only allow uni students to vote in their home town, not where they are studying.
attributes.background: Currently, university students can either vote in their uni town or home town and many choose the former. The huge density of students in certain areas now mean that students control the vote and their issues can dominate the political agenda and effectively disenfranchise the local community.
attributes.additional_details: This is not driven by anti-student sentiment but more through a sense of democracy. For example, if there was a General Election in their first week at uni, the student could vote in the uni town without any knowledge of local issues or the local MP. They will probably spend 27 months over 3 years at uni and yet a parliamentary term is 60 months, so their vote affects the area long after they've left! They can also vote in local elections, on local issues from Day 1.

attributes.action: Take immediate action to reduce emissions by 45% from 2010 levels by 2030.
attributes.background: The government must take immediate measures to limit global temperature rise to 1.5C, as advised by the UN's recent climate report. To achieve this, emissions need to be cut drastically in the next 12 years. Meanwhile, the government has been backing out of policies which achieve these targets.
attributes.additional_details:
Some actions should include:

-Boost renewable energy sources to 85% by 2050- (suggested in the UN report).
-Quickly phase out fossil fuels, especially coal.
-Reduce our dependance on gas and oil.
-Reinstate previous subsidies for electric/hybrid cars and ban the sale of fossil fuel cars within the decade.
-Expand and encourage the use of public transport across the UK.
-Encourage individuals to act and educate the public on sustainable living.
-Invest in technology to take CO2 from the air.

attributes.action: Reinstate Pension/Income Letters at Bangkok British Embassy
attributes.background:
As of the 12th of December 2018 British Citizens can no longer request a proof of income letter required to obtain a Retirement or Extension based on marriage visa in Thailand

Other Countries Embassy's have an option to sign an affidavit that your income is true.
attributes.additional_details:
The British Embassy has stated that this is because the Thai Immigration require proof that they cannot provide yet the current income letter already covers the embassy legally.  

The British Embassy has left us to resolve this with Thai immigration

The Thai immigration has not made any announcement and still requests the letter. Failing this retired or married Brits may be forced to transfer between £9-18,000 to a Thai bank as proof

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to learn how to pass equines safely,&include the highway code
attributes.background:
Educate new drivers about how to approach & overtake equines safely on the road.
Slowing down to a safe speed & passing with least 2m space.
Understand arm signals should a rider signal.
Safe passing can save lives.
Educate horse riders to wear hiviz and be seen.
attributes.additional_details:
The Glow Means Slow Campaign was created to help raise awareness to equestrians of how important it is to wear HiViz when out on the roads and rural lanes.
This is due to the rise In more accidents resulting in death and near misses lately between motorists and equines.
HiViz gives a driver between 3-5secs better reaction time.
A spooked horse can react at speeds up to 50mph.The recognised speed when injuries are more likely to result in death.

attributes.action: Increase use of restorative justice for adult offenders
attributes.background: Restorative Justice gives the victim the chance to have a meeting with their offender. In order for the meeting to take place, all of the parties have to agree to participate. The meeting is assisted by a mediator, and the aim is to discuss the offence and its consequences as a group.
attributes.additional_details: Researches show that RJ satisfies 85% of the victims and reduces the re-offending rate by 14% [https://restorativejustice.org.uk/criminal-justice]. Young offenders are offered RJ where appropriate, but this does not occur enough for adult offenders. We would like the government to introduce legislation that makes it mandatory to offer RJ to adult offenders where appropriate. Please sign if you agree that this would be a positive move forward for victims, offenders and the Criminal Justice per se. #RJ4EVERYONE

attributes.action: Don't charge food businesses 20% VAT on turnover
attributes.background: I want the government to stop charging food businesses 20% VAT. The reason for this is because our industry has barely any VAT to claim back and yet we get charged that 20% on our turnover which is unfair compared to other industries. This ruins cash flow and causes business owners financial issues.

attributes.action: Increase the cycle to work scheme limit from £1000 to £2000.
attributes.background: Introduced in 1999, the scheme allows workers to buy a bike and accessories through their workplace. If the scheme’s limit had tracked inflation it would now be over £1,600. In addition, e-bikes are now becoming popular, provide access to cycling to more people, but are even more expensive.
attributes.additional_details:
Some organisations have obtained permission from the FCA to provide loans to a higher limit, but many do not do this (e.g. due to the complexity of obtaining permission and costs).

This is a timely petition as officials from DfT, HMT and HMRC are reviewing the scheme’s guidance (including the limit) as part of the Government’s Cycling and Walking Investment Strategy.

Source of inflation data: https://www.bankofengland.co.uk/monetary-policy/inflation/inflation-calculator

attributes.action: To offer screening & preventative treatment for babies with flat head syndrome
attributes.background: Flat head syndrome is very common amongst babies. Currently treatment is not available on the NHS, research has shown that helmet therapy produces the same results as treating with repositioning and physical therapy. Flat head syndrome is caused either in utero or by constant pressure side of head
attributes.additional_details: The NHS uses evidence based research to commission treatment and for now they will not change their decision until more evidence is produced. So for now I propose that the government look at other treatments. 1. health visitors and doctors to include screening for all children as part of the 0-19 health programme so they can offer targeted support and advice. 2. early intervention and treatments like physical therapy put in to place to alleviate and prevent further flatness.

attributes.action: Abolish Student Fees for NHS Staff
attributes.background: My daughter is in her first year as a Student Paramedic, she already has debts totalling approximately £14,000 for her 1st year and this will every year for a total of 3 years.  NHS staff, Doctors, Nurses and Paramedics should not have to have these kinds of debts as they are benefiting the country.
attributes.additional_details: Paramedics, Doctors and Nurses are the forefront of the NHS, they have difficult jobs to do and with no support from the government.  I believe that there are a great deal of talented bright young people who simply cannot afford to go to University and as usual the poorer members of society cannot afford to follow their dreams.  My daughter had to take a 2 year gap to be able to save money to go to University.  She is very cautious with her money and we are unable to support her financially.

attributes.action: Set up a Select Committee for Adults with Learning Disabilities.
attributes.background: The working practice of services regarding adults with learning disabilities need investigating root to branch inside and out by a specially appointed Select Committee.
attributes.additional_details: Not fit for purpose the Parliamentary Health & Social Care Ombudsman,  Local Government Ombudsman, UNISON and others fail to provide a service and/or adequate standard of service to deal with Adults with Learning  Disabilities.

attributes.action: Vote on England & Wales to Leave the UK & EU.  Scotland & NI to Remain in both.
attributes.background:
If England and Wales leave the UK political union Scotland and Northern Ireland should be able to retain their membership as the remaining UK entity.  

The vote must take place as soon as possible in order to allow provision for Scotland and Northern Ireland to remain in the EU before Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
As per European Court of Justice ruling Article 50 could be unilaterally revoked by the remainder of the UK, Scotland and Northern Ireland, who would be the Continuing Member State.

England and Wales would be free to deliver Brexit without the need for a backstop arrangement.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all schools to be accessible to disabilities
attributes.background: We want there to be an introduction of legislation which mandates all UK schools to be fully accessible.This will include setting out national guidelines for schools to follow, taking the responsibility away from the local authorities ensures there will be consistency in the levels of accessibility.
attributes.additional_details:
Our hope is that one day, disabilities will no longer be a barrier to living life to the full. People with disabilities should never face discrimination and should never be excluded from buildings or activities because of a lack of access.

In a recent report by the Children's Commissioner Sally Holland, it was discovered that 4 out of 22 councils did not have their strategies in place even though they are required to do so by law, and the government have not updated their guidance since 2004!

attributes.action: Introduce legal standards for reporting tools on social media
attributes.background:
Finding disturbing accounts on social media which impact young children need to be investigated and removed with immediate effect. 

When reporting on social media the response is automated, you get told they won’t remove the account and the options are limited!
attributes.additional_details: It’s worrying that this happens even when reporting possible grooming of young girls.

attributes.action: Make asthma prescriptions free of charge as this is a chronic lifetime condition
attributes.background: Several other chronic conditions e.g. diabetes, hypothyroidism, get free prescriptions. I am not asking for all their medication to be free just those required to keep asthma under control.

attributes.action: Reduce the fees of Universities from £9,250 back to £3000 per year
attributes.background:
The cost of university fees in the UK are unacceptable seeing as public universities are financed by the government. 
It's not fair for students from low socioeconomic backgrounds who struggle finaiacially and students from higher economic background to be expected to pay the same fee of £9,250.
attributes.additional_details:
most uni's in the EU are free ,however, what we are seeing is that Universities are continuing to increase their fees and reduce the grants available. The saddest issue here is all courses cost the same, that means a degree in nursing costs the same per year as denistry. 
As a result it's making higher education more attractive to students who can afford it and making it more difficult for students from deprived areas and low income families make it to uni's due to the fear of burdening loans.

attributes.action: Investigate concerns about “infrasound” health issues from Wind Turbines
attributes.background: Thousands of people live within 20 kilometres of a wind turbine. Some people are concerned they may be suffering from health issues they believe are related to infrasound. There should be an investigation of this before more wind farms are built.
attributes.additional_details: "A five megawatt wind farm would possibly generate a detectable infrasound signal even from a distance of twenty kilometres." Dr. Lars Ceranna, Institute for Geosciences and Natural Resources, Germany.

attributes.action: Grant Carrol James the right to remain on indefinite leave in the UK
attributes.background: Carrol James arrived in October 2014 from South Africa with her husband who is a British citizen. Now, almost 5 years later and after a lengthy legal process, she is being refused the right to remain in the UK with her husband and family. She faces a return to a volatile and dangerous South Africa.
attributes.additional_details: Carrol James is a 74-year-old South African grandmother who, in October 2014, moved to the UK with her husband of over 40 years, Bernard James. Bernard is a full British citizen. Carrol was told that she would have to eventually return to South Africa. Bernard has been fighting this decision for the past 4 years, spending thousands of pounds in legal and administrative costs, and has now been told that it was all for nothing and that she will have to return to South Africa.

attributes.action: Grant student mothers the same protections as working mothers
attributes.background: Flexible working, maternity leave and nursing facilities are examples of protected provisions available to workers. Student mothers are just as vulnerable to maternity discrimination, yet these protections are seldom extended to them.This blind-spot has led to avoidable adversity and exclusion.
attributes.additional_details:
Education institutions are required under employment law to make maternity provisions for working mothers, yet there is no legal requirement ensuring that the same rights are extended to students who are mothers.

In spite of the Equality Act 2010, the rights of student mothers are primarily determined at their institution's discretion. Student mothers are easily marginalised and often squeezed out of the education system as a result. This must change.

attributes.action: Provide adoption allowance to self-employed people
attributes.background: Self employed people who give birth to a child are entitled to maternity allowance,  however a self employed person who wishes to adopt a child is not entitled to adoption allowance! This allowance is currently only available for employed people!
attributes.additional_details:
An independent review, led by leading entrepreneur Julie Deane, OBE recommends that self-employed adopters should have a statutory entitlement to a minimum level of income if they are unable to work because they are adopting a child. (Adoption UK) 

Self employment is increasing and reports show that adoption rates are falling despite there being an increase in Children needing families. 

I am calling on the government to readdress the inequality faced by self employed adopters.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence in the UK not to report discovering a death
attributes.background: Recently my brother passed away and the person who was staying with him never rang for help just left him on his own. I want to make this a criminal offence in the UK as it’s against the law in other countries. I need to get as many signatures as I can so no other family has to go through this.

attributes.action: Amend the Health & Social Care Act to increase focus on supporting relationships
attributes.background: Social Care inspections do not include specific reference to relationships & sex, making it possible to receive an ‘outstanding’ rating, whilst ignoring an essential part of people's lives. CQC said they cannot add mandatory questions for inspectors without amending the Health & Social Care Act
attributes.additional_details:
The questions submitted to CQC have been added as supplementary but not mandatory, meaning inspectors can currently choose not to ask them. The questions covered sexuality & relationships polices, sexual health, sexual rights and training for staff and people who use services. Read more about them https://www.choicesupport.org.uk/blog/easy-complacency-or-hard-commitment 

Social care staff are faced with difficult situations and are often untrained in this area, as it is not seen as a priority.

attributes.action: Declare a Climate Emergency, end fossil fuel use and build community resilience.
attributes.background: The current wave of extreme weather around the globe and in Britain indicates that the climate emergency predicted by our scientists is now here. We must prepare for community resilience in the face of climate impacts and take urgent steps to limit warming and reverse temperatures to 1980s levels.

attributes.action: Same sex unmarried/civil partnered parents to be on Childs birth certificate
attributes.background: In the UK same sex parents of donor children are unable to both go on their childs birth certificate - unless they are married/ civil partnered preconception or the child was conceived through the help of a registered fertility clinic. My son has only me on his birth certificate and it's wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Why is it ok for heterosexual couples to both be registered on birth certificate, some of these Fathers registered are not even the biological Fathers and no questions asked.

If anything were to happen to me my son would be an orphan due to no other parent having rights over him.

As a nation we have come so far with equality and rights, however the legislation and laws need to be updated to reflect this.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory awareness sessions for drivers/escorts of autistic people.
attributes.background:
When you have a special needs child, sometimes non verbal;  you must put your absolute trust in those involved with your child's care.

My child goes to school in special needs transport as do countless others.  There is NO requirement for those who care for him in this time to have any training.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like all taxi companies to ensure taxi drivers and escorts have an awareness session before applying for tender with local authorities.  

This is a UK wide problem.  It is inconceivable to think you would put your child into transport with someone who knows absolutely nothing about their condition or how to help if there is a problem.

Simple things like drivers being aware that something as small as an air freshener can cause great sensory distress.

attributes.action: Regulate the beauty & Aesthetics Industry to protect Non medics & the public
attributes.background: For a while now there has been a need for change and regulation within the beauty & aesthetics industry, but now more than ever we need to put in place a regulated UK body for Non medics alongside proper regulated qualifications that will allow non medics the correct recognised training
attributes.additional_details:
The UK beauty & aesthetics industry has many correctly trained and knowledgeable non medics providing aesthetics safely, however in the past few months this has been brought under scrutiny by medics and whilst many of the claims aimed at non medics are very unjust, it has  highlighted to many that the aesthetics & beauty industry as a whole needs to change.
The industry needs to be correctly & fairly regulated to protect not only the public but also protect non medics, their careers and futures!

attributes.action: Stop the tax payer funding Royal weddings.
attributes.background: Stop the tax payer funding royal weddings including the upcoming wedding. The Government needs to advise the Queen of the public outrage at this disgraceful waste of public money. The Royal Family have more than enough tax payer money to fund this flamboyant wedding themselves.
attributes.additional_details: At a time of public funding cuts to libraries, roads maintenance, police service and other publicly funding bodies it is a disgrace that the Government is even considering funding this wedding.

attributes.action: Have another general election
attributes.background: The government is dysfunctional. Current policies ranging from Universal Credit, NHS social care to Brexit are causing great dismay. This country deserves better. The government refuses to contribute to parliamentary votes, uses filibustering tactics and lacks transparency. This is not democracy.

attributes.action: Provide funding for a Military Veterans Hospital in every county of England.
attributes.background: In the USA they have discovered that if Veterans are treated in a Military Veterans Hospital their recovery time is approximately half that of a Veteran being treated in a civilian hospital.
attributes.additional_details: My wife and I went on an extended tour of the USA and visited the large Veterans Hospital in Nashville, Tennessee, where it was pointed out that Veterans recover far quicker in a Veterans Hospital compared to a veteran being treated in a civilian hospital.

attributes.action: Ban 'anti-homeless' benches in the UK
attributes.background: Just under a quarter of a million people are estimated to be sleeping rough in Britain, 2018. 'Anti-homeless' benches force the homeless to sleep on the cold floor this winter. Divided benches are an example of how the housing problem has not been tackled, with efforts to only blanket the truth.
attributes.additional_details: More than one in three people sleeping rough have been deliberately hit or kicked or experienced some other form of violence whilst homeless. If these individuals could spend the night on a bench, they could be away from the floor, nightclub doors or store entrances, in safer areas. The homeless are entitled to the same as any person, and these benches must be banned.
